The Elder Sālakusumīya’s Birth Story
“When the Lord Buddha,
the best of those with lotus-like feet, had attained final Nibbāna,🔽and the funeral pyre had been lit,
I worshipped with Sāla flowers.

analyzed: sata sahassitaḥ kappe  yam puppham abhiropayi
translated: For a hundred thousand eons🔽I worshipped with those flowers,
and I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping with flowers.
My defilements have been burnt up,
all my existences have been uprooted,
like an elephant breaking its bonds,
I live without pollutants.
How welcome it was for me
in the presence of the Buddha,
the three knowledges were attained,
and the Buddha’s instruction was fulfilled.
The four analytical insights,
and the eight liberations,
the six super-knowledges were realized,
and the Buddha’s instruction was fulfilled.”🔽Thus the elder Sālakusumīya recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā sālakusumiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Sālakusumiyattherassāpadānaṁ paṭhamaṁ.
